title: Apple Renews Mask Mandates in U.S. Stores as Covid-19 Surges
sub_head: Tech giant reimposes policy as California tightens indoor health protocols
body:
Apple Inc. stores across the U.S. are returning to requiring masks as Covid-19 cases surge.
The iPhone maker said Tuesday that the new mask mandate would apply to all customers and employees. The companyâ€™s prevention efforts have waned in recent months in step with U.S. infection rates, with masks being optional in domestic Apple stores since the first week of November.
